greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Greatest prime factor of prime(n+1)^2 + prime(n)^2.
comment: How small can members of this sequence be? For example, a(52837) = 97 since 650107^2 + 650099^2 =  2 * 5^4 * 29 * 37 * 73 * 89 * 97. - _Charles R Greathouse IV_, May 14 2014
link: Robert Israel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
program: a(n)=my(p=prime(n)); gpf(nextprime(p+1)^2 + p^2) \\ _Charles R Greathouse IV_, May 14 2014
results.author: _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Mar 29 2002
ext: Edited and extended by _Robert G. Wilson v_, Apr 18 2002
